crawl.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground
crawl.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The baby crawled across the floor.
crawl.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if an insect crawls, it moves using its legs
crawl.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: There’s a bug crawling up your leg.
crawl.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if a vehicle crawls, it moves forward very slowly
crawl.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to be too pleasant or helpful to someone in authority, especially because you want them to help you – used to show disapproval
crawl.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: She’s always crawling to the boss.
crawl.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The traffic had slowed to a crawl.
